conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when the light source moves to the right.
Object A (ball) casts shadow to the left.
Object B (apple) casts shadow to the left.
Object C (baseball) casts shadow to the right.
Object D (microphone) casts shadow to the right.
Shadows will shift towards the opposite direction (left) when the light source moves to the right.
Shadow C (baseball) changes from right to left.
Shadow D (microphone) changes from right to left.
Shadows may become longer or shorter depending on the light's movement.
If the light moves horizontally without changing the angle, shadows may not change in length.
If the light also lowers or raises, shadows can become longer or shorter.
Shapes of shadows remain consistent with object shapes but may stretch or contract based on light angle.
Shadow A and B extend further left.
Shadow C and D shift to the left, changing direction.
Shadows will shift to the left, with C and D changing casting direction due to light moving to the right.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left. Shadows C and D will change their direction.
